column1: New York City teenager Miles Morales struggles to live up to the expectations of his father
column3: who sees Spider-Man as a menace. Miles adjusts to boarding school
column4: and visits his uncle Aaron Davis
column5: who takes him to an abandoned subway station to paint graffiti. Miles is bitten by a radioactive spider and gains spider-like abilities similar to Spider-Man. Returning to the station
column6: Miles discovers a """Super-Collider""" built by Kingpin
column7: who hopes to access parallel universes to bring back his dead wife and son. Miles watches as Spider-Man attempts to disable the collider while fighting Kingpin's enforcers
column8: Green Goblin and Prowler. Spider-Man saves Miles
column9: but Green Goblin shoves Spider-Man into the collider
column10: causing an explosion that kills Green Goblin and severely wounds Spider-Man. He gives Miles a USB flash drive to disable the accelerator
column11: warning that the machine could destroy the city if reactivated. Watching in horror as Kingpin kills Spider-Man
column12: Miles flees from Prowler. As the city mourns Spider-Man's death
column13: Miles tries to honor his legacy and become New York's next superhero. Trying out his newfound abilities
column14: he damages the USB drive. At Spider-Man's grave
column17: worn-down version of Spider-Man from another dimension. Upon meeting him
column18: Miles discovers his ability to emit a bio-electric """venom""" blast. Peter reluctantly agrees to train Miles in exchange for help stealing data to create a new drive. They infiltrate Kingpin's research facility
column19: and Miles discovers he has the power to turn invisible. They are confronted by scientist Olivia Octavius
column20: who determines that Peter will die from cellular decay if he remains in their dimension. Chased through the laboratory and surrounding forest by Octavius
column21: Miles and Peter are rescued by Gwen Stacy
column22: a Spider-Woman from another dimension. They find Peter's aunt
column24: who is sheltering more heroes from other dimensions – Spider-Man Noir
column26: and Peni Parker – who are also deteriorating. Miles offers to disable the collider so the others can return home
column27: but the heroes tell him he lacks experience. Distraught
column29: where he discovers Aaron is Prowler. Miles returns to May's house
column30: where Peni has completed the new drive; he is followed by Kingpin
column34: and Tombstone. In the ensuing brawl
column35: Miles is captured by Aaron and unmasks himself. Unwilling to kill Miles
column36: Aaron is mortally shot by Kingpin. Miles flees with Aaron
column37: who tells him to keep going before dying of his injuries. Jefferson arrives on the scene and Miles escapes
column38: leading his father to believe Spider-Man killed Aaron. The heroes regroup at Miles's dorm. Peter restrains Miles to ensure his safety and leaves with the others
column39: choosing to sacrifice himself by staying behind and deactivating the collider. Jefferson arrives outside Miles's door and
column40: assuming he does not want to speak to him
column41: apologizes for his mistakes. Miles masters his powers and goes to May to acquire web shooters and repaint Peter's suit. He joins the heroes
column42: defeating Kingpin's enforcers and using the USB drive to send them home. Kingpin fights Miles
column44: who realizes Spider-Man is not the enemy and encourages him. Miles paralyzes Kingpin with his venom blast and throws him at the kill switch
column45: destroying the collider. Kingpin and his enforcers are arrested and Jefferson recognizes Spider-Man as a hero
column46: while Miles embraces the responsibilities of his new life. Back in their home dimensions
column47: the heroes return to their lives; Peter prepares to fix his relationship with Mary Jane
column48: and Gwen finds a way to contact Miles across dimensions. In another dimension
column49: Miguel O'Hara (Spider-Man 2099) travels to a 1967 New York and argues with that universe's Spider-Man.[N 1]
